description: Data was extracted from GDC in {---tag-release-month-year---}. All copy number abberations from the current release in a tab separated table. For more information on copy number data, please see http://cancer.sanger.ac.uk/cosmic/help/cnv/overview.

fields.name: CNV_ID
fields.description: The unique identifier for the variant (not stable, differs between releases).

fields.name: ID_GENE
fields.description: The ID of the gene which overlaps the copy number segment (or '-' where there is no overlapping gene).

fields.name: gene_name
fields.description: The symbol of the gene which overlaps the copy number segment (or '-' where there is no overlapping gene).

fields.name: ID_SAMPLE
fields.description: A sample is an instance of a portion of a tumour being examined for mutations. The sample name can be derived from a number of sources. In many cases it originates from the cell line name. Other sources include names assigned by the annotators, or an incremented number assigned during an anonymisation process. A number of samples can be taken from a single tumour and a number of tumours can be obtained from one individual. A sample id is used to identify a sample within the COSMIC database. There can be multiple ids, if the same sample has been entered into the database multiple times from different papers. These samples are from the ICGC and TCGA.

fields.name: ID_TUMOUR
fields.description: (see description for ID_SAMPLE)

fields.name: Primary_site
fields.description: The primary tissue/cancer from which the sample originated. More details on the tissue classification are avaliable from http://cancer.sanger.ac.uk/cosmic/classification. In COSMIC we have standard classification system for tissue types and sub types because they vary a lot between different papers.

fields.name: Site_subtype_1
fields.description: Further sub classification (level 1) of the samples tissue of origin.

fields.name: Site_subtype_2
fields.description: Further sub classification (level 2) of the samples tissue of origin.

fields.name: Site_subtype_3
fields.description: Further sub classification (level 3) of the samples tissue of origin.

fields.name: Primary_histology
fields.description: The histological classification of the sample.

fields.name: Histology_subtype_1
fields.description: Further histological classification (level 1) of the sample.

fields.name: Histology_subtype_2
fields.description: Further histological classification (level 2) of the sample.

fields.name: Histology_subtype_3
fields.description: Further histological classification (level 3) of the sample.

fields.name: SAMPLE_NAME
fields.description: The name of the sample.

fields.name: TOTAL_CN
fields.description: The sum of the major and minor allele counts eg if ABB, total copy number = 3.

fields.name: MINOR_ALLELE
fields.description: The number of copies of the least frequent allele eg if ABB, minor allele = A ( 1 copy) and major allele = B ( 2 copies).

fields.name: MUT_TYPE
fields.description: Defined as Gain or Loss. For ICGC samples; as defined in the original data. For TCGA samples reanalysed with ASCAT: GAIN = average genome ploidy <= 2.7 AND total copy number >= 5 OR average genome ploidy > 2.7 AND total copy number >= 9; LOSS = average genome ploidy <= 2.7 AND total copy number = 0 OR average genome ploidy > 2.7 AND total copy number < ( average genome ploidy - 2.7 )

fields.name: ID_STUDY
fields.description: Lists the unique Ids of studies that have involved this copy number variation.

fields.name: GRCh
fields.description: Coordinate system used

fields.name: Chromosome_G_Start_G_Stop
fields.description: The genomic coordinates of the variation.
